author: bridge-bot
content:
<nero_eth> I've just published the block-warming proposal + analysis:
https://ethresear.ch/t/block-level-warming/21452

The tldr is:
* block-level is "easy"
* multi-block is much more complex
* no refunds makes it less complex and, in the long run we might end up at the same.

author: bridge-bot
content: <jochembrouwer> Hey all, listening to the call, wanted to join yesterday but messed up my agenda. Super interesting! Regarding backwards compatibility in context of gas pricing, would an initial idea be (1) track down contracts which have hardcoded gas and (2) figure out how "popular" these are? Solidity by default will `GAS CALL` and thus "just" put current available gas on stack, and programmers have to explicitly set a gas param on the call to override this (I am not sure how much this is used in practice)

author: bridge-bot
content: <jochembrouwer> As a side note, but this is somewhat theoretical: these analysis might also get "trolled" by people by just creating abusive contracts which break once we update the gas schedule.

author: bridge-bot
content: <jochembrouwer> @adietrichs at the end of you call you mention tooling to see the throughput impact on mainnet on a gas schedule change, do you mean specific output diffs in terms of state (not taking into account the different cost of the tx)?
